#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=A 1-year long strike against FMC Novamed : Women workers allege unfair treatment
#Text=Monday , September 17 , 2007
#Text=In a free trade zone in Antalya , Turkey , 80 women workers of FMC Novamed are in strike for almost a year now , since September 26th , 2006 .
#Text=They allege not only low wages but also severe abuses on FMC 's part .
#Text=Novamed , founded in 2001 , is a factory managed by Turkish capitalists and located in the free trade zone in Antalya , Turkey . 95 % of its workers are women .
#Text=It is owned by Fresenius Medical Care ( FMC ) , which is an international corporation with its headquarters in Germany .
#Text=With factories in 12 countries and a total of 100,000 workers , FMC is a monopoly in the market of dialysis products .
#Text=Abuses by FMC Novamed
#Text=Following is a list of some of the abuses as alleged by the woman workers of the union :
#Text=Married woman workers are not allowed to become pregnant without FMC Novamed 's approval .
#Text=Each worker is given a schedule , which specifies during which months they are allowed to become pregnant .
#Text=If a woman worker becomes pregnant in " breach " of this given schedule , she is terminated without compensation .
#Text=Woman workers are required to get permission from the employer before getting married .
#Text=To " save energy " for their work at the factory , workers are being advised :
#Text=not to accept guests in their own homes when they are off the clock ,
#Text=not to communicate or even have sex with their spouses when they are off the clock ,
#Text=not to see each other when they are off the clock ,
#Text=only to eat and sleep when they are off the clock .
#Text=Workers are treated inhumanely , and continuously humiliated regardless of whether they make a mistake or not .
#Text=Managers and supervisors call their workers to their office and accuse and humiliate them in such a way that there are few workers who come out of these accusation-performances without crying .
#Text=Workers are not allowed to talk to each other during work hours , as well as in the shuttle during their trips from and to work .
#Text=Workers are allowed inside the factory premises after being " sniffed " by their supervisors , because smoking during work hours is forbidden .
#Text=During work hours , there is only a 15-minute break and a 25-minute lunch break .
#Text=During lunch , instead of food , the factory is serving tea and cookies .
#Text=An average shuttle trip from home to work may take as long as 2 hours because there are not enough shuttles allocated by the factory for the workers .
#Text=The Road to Forced Strike
#Text=In 2005 , FMC Novamed had 264 workers .
#Text=Workers applied to the Labor Ministry of Turkey for a union license after its union members ( 162 then ) became the majority among the factory 's workers .
#Text=However , they were sued for the license and due to the procedures of the lawsuit , the membership list of the union had to be given to the employer , FMC Novamed .
#Text=Following pressure from the company , workers started to quit the union , and even the factory itself .
#Text=When the union finally managed to start negotiations with FMC Novamed , they were greeted by an attitude of indifference .
#Text=As the negotiations were blocked , the union had to decide whether to strike .

#Text=They were inclined to apply to " Grand Arbitrator Committee " ( Yüksek Hakem Kurulu ) , a committee whose duty is to arbitrate between the employer and the employee when they cannot negotiate themselves and are bound for a strike .

column1: #Text=However , in the meantime , FMC Novamed employed an unfamiliar anti-union strategy : the factory employed workers and enrolled them in the union , but interestingly not as strike-breakers .
#Text=While the union workers voted for an arbitrator instead of going to strike , the factory-employed workers , now the majority , voted for the strike and won .

#Text=In the end , those who voted yes for the strike kept on working during the strike , while those who voted no ended up in a forced strike : if they would not strike , their union license would be revoked ...
#Text=FMC Novamed 's Response
#Text=FMC Novamed maintains that all the allegations by the union workers are a lie .
#Text=According to Cem Günaltay , the Finance Manager for Novamed , the workers who are on strike and all the members of the union are lying .
#Text=FMC 's International Production Manager Antonio Raffa claimed that the union is insincere and hypocritical in its allegations .
#Text=The Significance of Free Trade Zones

#Text=According to Burn ( 2005 , p. 170-172 ) , Free Trade Zones are established in " Third World " countries because they are generally exempt from tax , labor , safety , health , and environment laws when they do business in these zones .
#Text=In these zones , women are the preferred labor force because they can be hired for significantly lower pay and under significantly less desirable working conditions than men can .

#Text=Often from rural areas and unaware of their rights , in a setting with high unemployment rates , left unprotected by their nation-state , and already oppressed by the harsher patriarchal conditions of their societies , women workers in a transnational factory have little choice other than to accept the questionable work conditions imposed on them .
#Text=Support Meetings by Other Organizations
#Text=September 17th , 2007 - 7am - In front of the Şişli Adliyesi , İstanbul .
#Text=September 17th , 2007 - 5pm - In front of the Eminönü Üsküdar İskelesi , İstanbul .
